title: Direction
text: We can tell whether the parabola goes left or right based on the sign of a in the equation, $$x=a y^2+b y+c$$. If a is negative, then the parabola goes left, if it is positive, it goes right.

title: Direction
text: Since our a is negative, what does this tell us about our parabola?

title: Left Direction
text: Since our a is negative, we know that our parabola will open up towards the left.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: To find the vertex, we need to find the axis is symmetry, which is found using the formula, $$y=\frac{-b}{2} a$$.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry
text: To find the axis of symmetry, we have to find the b and a from our equation.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry
text: Our b and a are -4 and -1 respectively. Our axis of symmetry is $$y=-1\frac{4}{2}$$.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Now that we have our axis of symmetry, we want to plug it back into the original equation to find the x value of our vertex.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Since our y is -2, we plug it into our equation as, $$x=2^2-4\times-2+12$$. This gives us $$x=16$$.

title: Vertex
text: Since we know that our y is -2 and our x is 16, our vertex is at the coordinates, (16,-2).

title: Finding Intercepts
text: To graph our parabola, we need to know our x and y intercepts.

title: Finding the x-intercepts
text: Our x-intercept occurs when $$y=0$$. Knowing this, we substitute 0 into our equation.

title: Finding the x-intercepts
text: After plugging in $$y=0$$ to our equation, we see that a x-intercept occurs when $$x=12$$, so our x-intercept is (12,0).

title: Finding the y-intercepts
text: Our y intercepts occur when $$x=0$$. We plug in $$x=0$$ to our equation and solve for the y's.

title: Finding the y-intercepts
text: We must factor the GCF from our equation and factor the trinomial. After this, we solve for y, which are -6 and 2 in this case, so the x-intercepts are (0,-6) and (0,2).

title: Graphing
text: Now that we have all of our properties, we are ready to graph our parabolas.
